definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: He applied for a scholarship and won it at last.
sentences.chinese: 他申请了奖学金并终于获准。

sentences.english: You can also use National Instruments data acquisition hardware to control strobe lights.
sentences.chinese: 你也可以使用国家仪器数据获准硬件控制频闪灯。

sentences.english: The "Admission Notice" will be sent to the admitted applicants two weeks before registration.
sentences.chinese: 申请获准入学者将在开学注册前二周通知。

sentences.english: Mr. Yim said he hopes the Japanese government will allow the film to be shown there.
sentences.chinese: 严浩表示希望影片能获准在日本放映。

sentences.english: Second Xiangya Hospital AIDS Research allowed to participate in the above-mentioned two specific research.
sentences.chinese: 湘雅二医院艾滋病研究室获准参加上述两项专项研究。

sentences.english: By this time, even females were allowed to serve as stormtroopers.
sentences.chinese: 在这个时期，女性也正式获准参加冲锋队。

sentences.english: Longfellow was granted leave of absence in order for him to visit Germany "for the benefit of his health".
sentences.chinese: “为了有益于健康”，朗费罗被获准假期去德国一游。

sentences.english: Anyone who makes such a Peter-like confession will gain entry into the Kingdom of God.
sentences.chinese: 任何人像彼得一样宣告，都将会获准进入上帝的国度。

sentences.english: And when we were come to Rome, Paul was suffered to dwell by himself, with a soldier that kept him.
sentences.chinese: 我们进了罗马，保禄获准与看守他的士兵独居一处。

sentences.english: This was the first permitted use of the Olympic logo in a non-Olympic festival.
sentences.chinese: 这是第一次获准允许在非奥运会期间使用奥运会标志。

sentences.english: Her request has been acquiesced in.
He has been matriculated in the university.

sentences.chinese: 她获准丧假为父亲送葬。

sentences.english: The medicine is already approved to fight narcolepsy and sleepiness related to shift work.
sentences.chinese: 此药已经获准用于治疗因倒班产生的嗜睡和瞌睡症状。

definition: official written ruling in response to a submission/official approval in writing
to cease/to suspend/to break off/to stop/to discontinue
first (hotel of its type, store of its type etc)
to reply officially to a subordinate
to expire/to run out/to come to an end
